member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.Ping
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the server is working or not.
If the server is not working, and the "being dead" timeout has been expired it will reinitialize itself.
member.remarks: It's possible that the server is still not up & running so the next call to could mark the instance as dead again.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.Acquire
member.summary: Acquires a new item from the pool
member.returns: An instance which is connected to the memcached server, or null if the pool is dead.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources allocated by this instance

member.name: P:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.EndPoint
member.summary: Gets the of this instance

member.name: P:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.IsAlive

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether the server is working or not. Returns a cached state.
To get real-time information and update the cached state, use the method.

member.remarks: Used by the to quickly check if the server's state is valid.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified item from the cache.
member.param: The identifier for the item to delete.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully removed from the cache; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified item from the cache.
member.param: The identifier for the item to retrieve.
member.returns: The retrieved item, or null if the key was not found.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Get``1(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified item from the cache.
member.param: The identifier for the item to retrieve.
member.returns: The retrieved item, or null if the key was not found.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Increment(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Increments the value of the specified key by the given amount. The operation is atomic and happens on the server.
member.param: The identifier for the item to increment.
The amount by which the client wants to increase the item.
member.returns: The new value of the item or -1 if not found.
member.remarks: The item must be inserted into the cache before it can be changed. The item must be inserted as a . The operation only works with values, so -1 always indicates that the item was not found.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Decrement(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Increments the value of the specified key by the given amount. The operation is atomic and happens on the server.
member.param: The identifier for the item to increment.
The amount by which the client wants to decrease the item.
member.returns: The new value of the item or -1 if not found.
member.remarks: The item must be inserted into the cache before it can be changed. The item must be inserted as a . The operation only works with values, so -1 always indicates that the item was not found.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Store(Enyim.Caching.Memcached.StoreMode,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts an item into the cache with a cache key to reference its location.
member.param: Defines how the item is stored in the cache.
The key used to reference the item.
The object to be inserted into the cache.
member.remarks: The item does not expire unless it is removed due memory pressure.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully stored in the cache; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Store(Enyim.Caching.Memcached.StoreMode,System.String,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a range of bytes (usually memory area or serialized data) into the cache with a cache key to reference its location.
member.param: Defines how the item is stored in the cache.
The key used to reference the item.
The data to be stored.
A 32 bit integer that represents the index of the first byte to store.
A 32 bit integer that represents the number of bytes to store.
member.remarks: The item does not expire unless it is removed due memory pressure.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully stored in the cache; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Store(Enyim.Caching.Memcached.StoreMode,System.String,System.Object,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Inserts an item into the cache with a cache key to reference its location.
member.param: Defines how the item is stored in the cache.
The key used to reference the item.
The object to be inserted into the cache.
The interval after the item is invalidated in the cache.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully stored in the cache; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Store(Enyim.Caching.Memcached.StoreMode,System.String,System.Object,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Inserts an item into the cache with a cache key to reference its location.
member.param: Defines how the item is stored in the cache.
The key used to reference the item.
The object to be inserted into the cache.
The time when the item is invalidated in the cache.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully stored in the cache; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.CheckAndSet(System.String,System.Object,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Updates an item in the cache with a cache key to reference its location, but only if it has not been changed since the last retrieval. The invoker must pass in the value returned by called "cas" value. If this value matches the server's value, the item will be updated; otherwise the update fails.
member.param: The key used to reference the item.
The object to be inserted into the cache.
The unique value returned by .
member.remarks: The item does not expire unless it is removed due memory pressure.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.CheckAndSet(System.String,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt64)

member.param: The key used to reference the item.
The data to be stored.
A 32 bit integer that represents the index of the first byte to store.
A 32 bit integer that represents the number of bytes to store.
The unique value returned by .
member.remarks: The item does not expire unless it is removed due memory pressure.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources allocated by this instance
member.remarks: Technically it's not really neccesary to call this, since the client does not create "really" disposable objects, so it's safe to assume that when the AppPool shuts down all resources will be released correctly and no handles or such will remain in the memory.

member.name: T:Enyim.FNV64
member.summary: Implements a 64 bit long Fowler-Noll-Vo hash.
member.remarks: Calculation found at http://lists.danga.com/pipermail/memcached/2007-April/003846.html, but it is pretty much available everywhere

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the amount of time after which receiving data from the socket fails.
member.returns: The value of the receive timeout. The default is 10 seconds.

member.name: P:Enyim.Caching.Configuration.SocketPoolElement.DeadTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the amount of time after which an unresponsive (dead) server will be checked if it is working.
member.returns: The value of the dead timeout. The default is 2 minutes.

summary.para: Implements a very fast object factory for dynamic object creation. Dynamically generates a factory class whihc will use the new() constructor of the requested type.
Much faster than using Activator at the price of the first invocation being significantly slower than subsequent calls.

member.name: M:Enyim.Reflection.FastActivator.CreateInstance(System.Type)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the specified type using a generated factory to avoid using Reflection.
member.param: The type to be created
member.returns: The newly created instance.

member.name: M:Enyim.Reflection.FastActivator.CreateInstance``1
member.summary: Creates an instance of the type designated by the specified generic type parameter using a generated factory to avoid using Reflection.
member.returns: The newly created instance.

member.summary: The ID of theis instance. Used by the to identify the instance in its inner lists.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket.Destroy
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this instance and shuts down the inner . This instance will not be usable anymore.
member.remarks: Use the IDisposable.Dispose method if you want to release this instance back into the pool.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket.ReadLine
member.summary: Reads a line from the socket. A line is terninated by \r\n.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket.SendCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Sends the command to the server. The trailing \r\n is automatically appended.
member.param: The command to be sent to the server.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket.GetCommandBuffer(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the bytes representing the specified command. returned buffer can be used to streamline multiple writes into one Write on the Socket using the
member.param: The command to be converted.
member.returns: The buffer containing the bytes representing the command. The returned buffer will be terminated with 13, 10 (\r\n)
member.remarks: The Nagle algorithm is disabled on the socket to speed things up, so it's recommended to convert a command into a buffer and use the to send the command and the additional buffers in one transaction.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads data from the server into the specified buffer.
member.param: An array of that is the storage location for the received data.
The location in buffer to store the received data.
The number of bytes to read.
member.remarks: This method blocks and will not return until the specified amount of bytes are read.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket.ReadResponse
member.summary: Reads the response of the server.
member.returns: The data sent by the memcached server.
member.exception: The server did not sent a response or an empty line was returned.
The server did not specified any reason just returned the string ERROR. - or - The server returned a SERVER_ERROR, in this case the Message of the exception is the message returned by the server.
The server did not recognize the request sent by the client. The Message of the exception is the message returned by the server.

member.summary: The total number of connections ever made to the server.

member.summary: Cache hit.

member.summary: Cache miss.

member.summary: Number of bytes written to the server.

member.name: T:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.DefaultNodeLocator
member.summary: This is a ketama-like consistent hashing based node locator. Used when no other is specified for the pool.
